How BLite fits in the .NET embedded database landscape â€” and why it's unlike anything else available today.

The Embedded Database Landscape

The .NET ecosystem has several options for embedded or local data storage. Each one makes different trade-offs between performance, size, flexibility, and modernity. BLite was designed to fill a gap that none of the existing solutions cover.

What Makes BLite Unique

0
Reflection Calls
0
Dependencies
0
Native Binaries
100%
AOT Compatible

BLite is the only embedded document database for .NET that combines source-generated mappers, zero reflection, and full NativeAOT support in a pure managed library with zero external dependencies.

This means:

  • Instant startup â€” no runtime type scanning or mapper initialization.
  • Trimmer-safe â€” publish tiny self-contained binaries without worrying about reflection metadata.
  • Cross-platform without friction â€” no native interop, no platform-specific builds.
  • Compile-time safety â€” mapping errors surface at build time, not at runtime.

ğŸŒ A Cosmos DB for Embedded Applications

Azure Cosmos DB popularized the idea of a globally distributed, multi-model document database. BLite brings the same document-oriented philosophy to the embedded world:

ConceptAzure Cosmos DBBLite
Data FormatJSON / BSONBSON
Data ModelDocument-orientedDocument-oriented
PartitioningPartition keysCollections
SchemaSchema-freeSchema-free
IndexingAutomatic + customExplicit indexes + R-Tree
TransactionsScoped to partitionFull ACID per database
Change FeedChange FeedChange Data Capture
DistributionCloud-native globalEmbedded P2P via EntglDb
DeploymentCloud serviceIn-process library
CostRU-based billingFree & open source

If you think of Cosmos DB as "a document database that scales globally in the cloud", then BLite is "a document database that runs locally with cloud-like capabilities on any device."

ğŸ”— BLite + EntglDb = Embedded Distributed Database

On its own, BLite is a powerful single-node embedded database. When paired with EntglDb, it becomes something entirely new in the .NET ecosystem: an embedded, peer-to-peer distributed document database.

ğŸŒ EntglDb â€” Peer-to-Peer Data Sync for .NET

EntglDb is a distributed data synchronization framework that provides:

  • P2P Replication â€” nodes sync directly without a central server.
  • Conflict Resolution â€” automatic CRDT-based or custom resolution strategies.
  • Offline-First â€” each node works independently and syncs when connected.
  • Pluggable Persistence â€” BLite is a first-class persistence backend.
ğŸ“± App ABLite + EntglDb
âŸ·
ğŸ’» App BBLite + EntglDb
âŸ·
ğŸ–¥ï¸ App CBLite + EntglDb
Each node runs a full BLite database locally â€” data syncs peer-to-peer via EntglDb

This combination enables scenarios that were previously only possible with cloud backends:

  • Multi-device sync â€” MAUI apps on phones, tablets, and desktops stay in sync without a server.
  • Edge computing â€” IoT devices replicate readings across a mesh network.
  • Collaborative apps â€” multiple users share data in real-time with conflict resolution.
  • Resilient architectures â€” no single point of failure; every node owns its data.

ğŸ¯ Target Scenarios

ğŸ“±

Mobile (MAUI)

AOT-compiled MAUI apps with instant data access, no native SQLite dependency, and optional P2P sync between devices.

ğŸŒ¡ï¸

IoT & Edge

Lightweight data storage on resource-constrained devices. Spatial indexing for geo-enabled sensors. Mesh sync via EntglDb.

âš™ï¸

CLI & Background Services

Trimmed, single-file executables with embedded persistence. Zero startup overhead from reflection-free design.

ğŸ–¥ï¸

Desktop Apps

WPF, WinUI, Avalonia â€” any .NET desktop framework. Local-first storage with CDC for reactive UI updates.

ğŸ§ª

Testing & Prototyping

In-memory mode for fast unit tests. No external process, no cleanup. Perfect for integration testing.

ğŸ—ï¸

Microservices

Local caching or event sourcing with ACID guarantees and zero infrastructure. EntglDb adds state replication across instances.

When to Use What

Choose BLite whenâ€¦

  • You need NativeAOT or trimming.
  • You want zero dependencies and pure managed code.
  • You prefer document-oriented data over relational tables.
  • You want compile-time mapping safety.
  • You need spatial indexing or CDC built-in.
  • You want a fully async API.

Choose SQLite + EF Core whenâ€¦

  • You need complex relational queries (joins, aggregates).
  • You have an existing SQL schema you must reuse.
  • You need full-text search.

Choose LiteDB whenâ€¦

  • You don't need AOT and reflection is acceptable.
  • You need BsonExpression-based LINQ queries.
  • You are on .NET Framework and can't upgrade.
ğŸ“¦ Get Started

Ready to try BLite? Install it from NuGet:

dotnet add package BLite
dotnet add package BLite.SourceGenerators

Pair it with EntglDb for distributed scenarios:

dotnet add package EntglDb.Persistence.BLite

Check the Getting Started guide for a full walkthrough.
